security_rule.name: http_webui_spark
security_rule.description: Allow Web UI Access to Spark

security_rule.name: http_rest_spark
security_rule.description: Allow REST API Access to Spark

definition.description: The name of the availability set for the slave/agent machines
The name of the network interface card used by Cassandra
The private IP address of Cassandra's network interface card
The name of the network interface card for Master
The private IP address used by the Master's network interface card
The prefix used to constitute the slave/agents' names
The prefix of the private IP address used by the network interface card of the slave/agent nodes
The name of the network security group for Cassandra
The name of the network security group for Spark's Master
The name of the network security group for Spark's slave/agent nodes
The name of Cassandra's node's public IP address
The name of the master node's public IP address
The prefix to the slave/agent nodes' IP address names
Number of VMs to create to support the slaves.  Each slave is created on it's own VM.  Minimum of 2 & Maximum of 200 VMs. min = 2, max = 200
The location/region where the virtual network is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Resource group name into which your Spark and Cassandra deployment will go.
Storage type that is used for Cassandra. This storage account is used to store VM disks. Allowed values are Standard and Premium.
Storage type that is used for Cassandra. This storage account is used to store VM disks. Possible values include LRS and GRS.
This prefix is used for names which need to be globally unique.
Storage Tier that is used for master Spark node. This storage account is used to store VM disks. Allowed values are Standard and Premium.
Storage Tier that is used for master Spark node. This storage account is used to store VM disks. Possible values include LRS and GRS.
Storage type that is used for each of the slave Spark node. This storage account is used to store VM disks. Allowed values are Standard and Premium.
Storage type that is used for each of the slave Spark node. This storage account is used to store VM disks. Possible values include LRS and GRS.
The name of the storage account container used by the Cassandra node
The name of the storage account container used by Spark's master
The name of the storage account container used by the slave/agent nodes
The name used for the Master subnet.
The address prefix to use for the Master subnet.
The name used for the slave/agent subnet.
The address prefix to use for the slave/agent subnet.
The name used for the subnet used by Cassandra.
The address prefix to use for the subnet used by Cassandra.
The base URI where artifacts required by this template are located.
the name of the offer (az vm image list)
name of the publisher of the image (az vm image list)
version of the image to apply (az vm image list)
The name of the script kept in version control which will provision Cassandra

Specify an admin password that should be used to login to the VM. Must be between 6-72 characters long and must satisfy at least 3 of password complexity requirements from the following: 1) Contains an uppercase character 2) Contains a lowercase character 3) Contains a numeric digit 4) Contains a special character
Specify an admin username that should be used to login to the VM. Min length: 1
The name of the virtual machine used by Cassandra
The name of the os disk used by the Cassandra virtual machine

VM size for Cassandra node.  This VM should be sized based on workloads. Allowed values: Standard_D1_v2, Standard_D2_v2, Standard_D3_v2, Standard_D4_v2, Standard_D5_v2, Standard_D11_v2, Standard_D12_v2, Standard_D13_v2, Standard_D14_v2, Standard_A8, Standard_A9, Standard_A10, Standard_A11
The name of the script kept in version control which will provision Spark
The name of Spark's Master virtual machine
The name of the os disk used by Spark's Master virtual machine

VM size for master Spark node.  This VM can be sized smaller. Allowed values: Standard_D1_v2, Standard_D2_v2, Standard_D3_v2, Standard_D4_v2, Standard_D5_v2, Standard_D11_v2, Standard_D12_v2, Standard_D13_v2, Standard_D14_v2, Standard_A8, Standard_A9, Standard_A10, Standard_A11
The name prefix used by Spark's slave/agent nodes
The prefix used to constitute the names of the os disks used by the slave/agent nodes

VM size for slave Spark nodes.  This VM should be sized based on workloads. Allowed values: Standard_D1_v2, Standard_D2_v2, Standard_D3_v2, Standard_D4_v2, Standard_D5_v2, Standard_D11_v2, Standard_D12_v2, Standard_D13_v2, Standard_D14_v2, Standard_A8, Standard_A9, Standard_A10, Standard_A11
The address space that is used by the virtual network. You can supply more than one address space. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
